text: it wasn't some fleeting thing I mean it
was a standoff love it was you know
shadows firing running around bombs
going off and the shrapnel is up on the
third floor it's actually a part of
where my closet is this area right here
was where one of the bombs had exploded
you can see that the charring and a fan
out and actually see that it did
significant damage to the pavement the
first pipe bombs were like louder than
shotguns but less than say the cannon
did goes off when the Patriots score
touchdown the last one that went off was
the most impressive thing I've ever
witnessed it was blinding it shook the
walls of the house knocked pictures off
our wall at which point I saw the
suspect number one come running along
the fence on Laurel Street and go across
the street and a cop ran out and tackled
him to the ground had his his leg on him
with the gun drawn it was telling him
you know don't move don't move at which
point the SUV came and actually ran over
his brother and dragged him about 20
feet in the road hit the police car that
was on the side of the road and then
went straight through the intersection
on lots of people are coming to take a
peek to see the damage there's obviously
lots of news reporters all the evidence
and stuff have been removed before it
was open to the public so people are
just I guess just curious to see what it
looks like and what happened here this
is definitely Boston's
if you want to call it a mini 9/11 this
thing's historic you got to come out and
I brought my daughter and you've got to
come out and just basically see what
happened we stopped at the boat scene
you can't get very close to that the
police are processing that crime scene
and now this is stopped too so we wanted
to see this location this is actually
better
because of the stains on the street and
then we'll take a look at the bullet
holes on the on the houses it's pretty
understandable people are coming here
though I mean I think for a lot of the
people in the water tenant area and just
in Boston this is a chance to kind of
maybe understand a little more what
happened and I think it's helping people
deal with just the sheer insanity of
what occurred human curiosity being what
it is I had to watch everything and I
spent the night taking pictures of the
well the car was abandoned at that point
and the police sent robots down to see
if there were more weapons in there
which which I think there was there look
there was one point where the one of the
robots there's two one of the robots
came back with a big silver container
that looked like a would it be a
pressure cooker or something that one at
the top yeah and that one we were
looking out of that window like idiot
while I was going on it didn't really
hit us but you know we've all commented
that a day or two later you've really
kind of sunk in that you know our
families might my daughter could have
been killed
so I think there's this whole process is
helping people just kind of feel better
